thread.title: Arsenal's Santi Cazorla to miss rest of season through injury - source
thread.title_full: Arsenal's Santi Cazorla to miss rest of season through injury - source

author: ESPN staff
title: Arsenal's Santi Cazorla to miss rest of season through injury - source
text:
2 hours ago Arsenal's Santi Cazorla to miss rest of season through injury - source ESPN FC's Shaka Hislop shares his thoughts on whether or not Arsenal should transition Lucas Perez from a sub to a starter. Steve Nicol believes Tottenham will finally finish above Arsenal for the first time since the 1994/1995 season. Theo Walcott is the 18th player to hit 100 goals for Arsenal. Here are some of his most memorable strikes for the Gunners. The FC crew debate whether or not pressure will be deflected from Arsene Wenger should he lead Arsenal to the FA Cup title. The FC panel react to the 'inevitable' result of Arsenal downing Sutton United in their FA Cup fifth round matchup. 
Arsenal midfielder Santi Cazorla will miss the rest of the season as his recovery from foot surgery is taking longer than expected, a source has told ESPN FC. 
Cazorla had surgery in December on an inflamed tendon, and needed a second procedure last month after suffering a setback. 
Manager Arsene Wenger had been hoping the Spain international would be back by April, but a club source confirmed to ESPN FC that he won't return this season. 
The Daily Mirror first reported Cazorla's new setback on Thursday , saying he is now targeting a return in August. 
His continued absence is a big blow to the Gunners, who have struggled to cope without his influence in central midfield, where his quick passing is one of the keys to Arsenal's style of play. 
Aaron Ramsey has been in and out of the team because of injuries, while Granit Xhaka recently served a four-game suspension because of a second red card. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain has impressed in recent games when given the chance to play centrally, but Wenger is still searching for his best midfield partnership in Cazorla's absence. 
The Gunners don't have a game this weekend but travel to Liverpool next Saturday before taking on Bayern Munich in the return leg of their Champions League round-of-16 tie. Arsenal are fighting with Liverpool for a top-four spot in the Premier League, while they lost 5-1 to Bayern in the first leg and now have a slim chance of advancing. 
Ramsey could ease their midfield woes as he is expected back in training next week and could be fit for the Liverpool match. 
Follow @ESPNFC on Twitter to keep up with the latest football updates.
